## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard that the Verus testnet is really powerful. Can you create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains on the Verus mainnet without any programming?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's not correct. You can do all of that on the Verus testnet, but not on the mainnet. The Verus testnet allows you to create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains without any programming. It's a great way to experiment and test out new ideas without affecting the mainnet.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also heard that you can only send currencies within the same chain on the Verus testnet. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not true. On the Verus testnet, you can send currencies worldwide on the same chain, or even across different blockchains with ease. This means that you can send currencies not only within the same chain but also across different blockchains. The Verus testnet provides a high degree of flexibility and interoperability, making it a great platform for testing and developing new use cases.
Can you create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains on the Verus mainnet without any programming?
No, this is possible on the Verus testnet, not the mainnet. The Verus testnet allows you to create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains without any programming.

## Signing transactions from multi-signature IDs (testnet and mainnet)
Create transaction, get raw transaction data:
  ```
  verus sendcurrency <multi-signature-ID>@ '[{"address":"<destination_address>","amount":<transaction_amount>}]'
  verus z_getoperationstatus <operation_id_returned_by_sendcurrency>
  ```
Take the raw hex transaction data provided by z_getoperationstatus to each additional wallet(s) containing the additional signing addresses/IDs:
  ```
  verus signrawtransaction <raw_hex_transaction>
  ```
After the last necessary signature is applied, broadcast on the network using:
  ```
  verus sendrawtransaction <raw_hex_signed_transaction>
  ```## New Verus Multicurrency, Multichain, DeFi Enabled Testnet
With an easy GUI for basic operations or command line for more advanced functions. Without any programming, you can now create new identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains for your business, your government, your projects, a worthy cause, your family, or your next decentralized application suite. Send currencies worldwide on the same chain, or across blockchains with ease. Even convert currencies to others on the network without an exchange by sending to yourself and converting along the way.The new Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. It is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets, and it is the beginning of a new age in crypto. There are so many things you can do with Verus that you cannot with any other cryptocurrency platform, and you can try them all today.
Is it possible to send currencies only within the same chain on the Verus testnet?

No, it is possible to send currencies worldwide on the same chain, or across blockchains with ease on the Verus testnet. This means that you can send currencies not only within the same chain but also across different blockchains.
